title: Ticket #738: No documentation on writing custom classad functions
description:
The classad library in Condor has both built-in functions, and a way for folks to add custom functions via a shared library via the config param CLASSAD_USER_LIBS.

We don't have anything in the manual about this.

All we have to look at is:

  1. The method classad::FunctionCall::RegisterSharedLibraryFunctions() in src/classad/fnCall.cpp which actually implements this functionality.

  2. Some pithy example files on how to use it buried in the source code: src/classad/shared.cpp

  3. A research paper yammering about the motivation/design of the mechanism.

  4. Maybe a regression test to look at in the test suite?
